CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 1, 1941, pg. 8, reads: "When lovely Ruth Goode became the bride of William White last Friday afternoon, the sartorial perfection was in order. The perfectly groomed party includes, left to right: Robert Lavelle, James Goode (ushers); Franklin Dudley, best man; Mr. and Mrs. William White, Mrs. Mary Dudley, matron of honor; Miss Harriet Deaton, Miss Betty Dickerson, bridesmaids; Master Russell Goode, ringbearer. - Harris Photo." Portions of article read: "Ruth Goode, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. W. H. Goode, became the bride of Ralph Warner White, son of Mrs. Mamie White of Keystone, W. Va., on Friday afternoon in Clark Memorial Baptist Church.  Rev. E. P. Tunie performed the ceremony....The couple will reside at 1002 Blackadore Street, Homewood.  Mr. and Mrs. White are graduates of West Virginia State College..."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of wedding party, from left: Robert Lavelle, James Goode, best man Franklin Dudley, groom Ralph Warner White, bride Ruth Goode White wearing long sleeved gown with scalloped lace yoke, matron of honor Mary Dee Goode Dudley, Harriet Deaton, Betty Dickerson, and ring bearer Russell Goode, posed in Clark Memorial Baptist Church, Homestead
